Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.guiControl.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CoopGuiController
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Primary JavaFX controller for the single-player / local-multiplayer game view.

This class coordinates the UI components for the game board, preview pane, score/time display, overlays (pause, controls, game-over) and delegates rendering and input handling to a set of small helper classes. It deliberately keeps only minimal game logic and instead calls into the application's event listener / game engine via setEventListener(com.comp2042.input.InputEventListener).

Most heavy-lifting UI helpers were extracted to package-private helper classes in the same package (e.g. GuiRenderingHelpers, GuiParticleHelpers, GuiInputHandler) to keep this controller focused on wiring and lifecycle management.

    • playLockEffect

      protected void playLockEffect(ViewData start, ViewData end, boolean intense)
      Parameters:
      start - the ViewData before the drop (may be null)
      end - the ViewData after the drop/lock (may be null)
      intense - when true use shorter/faster animation and higher opacity (for hard drops)

      public void stopOverlayAudio()
      Public convenience: stop any overlay-related audio/pulse used by this GUI. Intended for external coordinators (e.g. multiplayer controllers) to request immediate audio cleanup without exposing internal implementation.
